thread.title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus spotted on online retailer, specs and images leaked
thread.title_full: Moto G5 and G5 Plus spotted on online retailer, specs and images leaked

title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus spotted on online retailer, specs and images leaked
text:
Moto G5 and G5 Plus spotted on online retailer, specs and images... Moto G5 and G5 Plus spotted on online retailer, specs and images leaked By February 16, 2017 “The new Moto G smartphones will offer all-metal body, water repellent coatings and Android Nougat” 
Lenovo is expected to launch its next-gen Moto G series devices – the Moto G5 and G5 Plus – later this month at MWC in Barcelona. Ahead of the unveiling, the Moto G5 and G5 Plus had already been leaked a number of times. Now a Spanish retailer has prematurely listed the Moto G5 and G5 Plus, revealing their complete specs and official renders. 
As per the retailer, the Moto G5 will sport a 5-inch full HD display, and will be powered by a Snapdragon 430 SoC, mated to 2GB of RAM. The phone will come with 32GB of expandable storage, a 13-megapixel primary camera, a 5-megapixel secondary shooter and a 2,800mAh battery with 10W rapid charging support. 
The Moto G5 Plus, on the other hand, will sport a bigger 5.2-inch full HD display with a layer of Gorilla Glass 3 on top. It will be fuelled by a Snapdragon 625 SoC, coupled with 2GB of RAM. The device will come with 64GB of expandable storage, a 12-megapixel rear snapper with dual autofocus pixels, a 5-megapixel selfie shooter, NFC and a 3,000mAh battery with support for TurboPower charging. 
The Moto G5 and G5 Plus will flaunt metal unibody designs, fingerprint sensors embedded into their home buttons, water repellent coatings and Android Nougat. They are expected to be available in major markets including India in March. We will be attending Lenovo’s pre-MWC event on February 26th to get you all the official details regarding their specs, price and availability.
